pageContext.claim: “Remember, they're building a big pipeline in Europe, going right up to Germany. And I said to Angela [Merkel] -- who I have a great relationship -- but I said, ‘You know, you pay Russia billions of dollars and then we defend you from Russia.’”
pageContext.analysis: The United States contributes to NATO to protect its own national security and economic interests. NATO contributions from member nations do not go into a bank account somewhere; it's actually what each country spends on its own defense as a percentage of GDP. The United States has defense priorities and interests around the globe and not just in Western Europe, so it's not a meaningful comparison Trump makes.
